column5: I'm thinking about taking up an inflatable kayak. Where we fish, there are some shallow, narrow feeder creeks where we have sighted some big northerns, but the boat spooks everything. Plus it would give my wife something to do as she refuses to fish or even go out in the motor boat....my mistake. Any experience with these? thanks
Don't hit anything sharp with it!

They are very wet rides. To get one stiff enough to paddle efficiently, the cost are 2x what a normal plastic fishing model kayak would cost (and 4x what a sporting good store recreational kayak would cost). .
You mean like my topwater flying back at me at 100 mph after pulling it out of a tree?
That or don't drop your fillet knife in the kayak.
